titleStmt.title: Letter, Southgate Cregmile in Murfreesboro, Tenn., to Crittenden Cregmile, 1863 June 5

publicationStmt.publisher: The University of Tennessee Libraries Digital Initiatives

bibl.title: Letter, Southgate Cregmile in Murfreesboro, Tenn. to Crittenden Cregmile, 1863, June 5
bibl.note: 1863 June 5 Southgate Cregmile in Murfreesboro, Tenn., to his brother Crittenden. Assures him that everyone there is presently well. Packing an eight day supply of rations after marching orders issued. Tells of a hanging today in their camp, witnessed by about twenty thousand men, and that another has been scheduled for tomorrow. Needs to go for roll call. Asks that he and everyone else write soon.

projectDesc.p: Machine-readable transcription created for the University of Tennessee Libraries Special Collections.

editorialDecl.p: Errors in transcription of the printed text not controlled.
Editorial tags limited to gap and unclear.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

revisionDesc.change: Migrating from XML to validated TEI P5.

div.p: I sent my seat my self this evening to rite you a few lines to let you know that we are all well at presant.
the weather is very warm and rainey. we have marching orders now for some place I doent know where we have Eight days rashions packed now. we have five in our napsack and three in our haversack.
hunge close to our Camp to day and a nother one to be hunge tomorrow. there were a bout twenty thousand of us there to see him hung.
I havent time to rite any more to night for it is nearly roll call now.
and all the rest of the familey
